intro: Eremocaulon triramis, commonly known as the three-branched feather grass, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are often clustered at the base of the stems. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Eremocaulon triramis is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to low-nutrient conditions.
